titleStmt.title: George R. Price et al. to James F. Robinson
CWG8787

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p: To J F Robinson Governor of the State of Kentucky

Your petioners would respectfully state to you the following facts (to wit) in June 1861 Harison Pointer being a little drunk went to Daniel Casaday's and there acted imponderably in quarrelling with said Cassady and in cutting a good many unnecessary shins. for which the said Pointer was indited by the grand jury of Metcalfe County and and at the Novm Term of the Equity & criminal court held in said county there was a judgment against the said Pointer for the sum of $100. Now the said Pointer is a poor man and a hard working man and has a large and helpless family to suport and if your Honor will remit said fine you have his promise to mind his course and not do so any more

Pettn of Harrison Pointer of Metcalf County to remit fine
Pettn of Harrison Pointer of Metcalf County to remit fine

Metcalfe Eq. & Crim Ct
Remitted excedpt Twenty ten dollars & costs
J F Robinson
$100 } Breach
Is Apr 1. 1863
